trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_SEQ_00<tab><var 48 F201FC /var><var 49 F201FD /var> Quest Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The grizzled hunter seeks a stout arm to help teach a lasting lesson.
TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_TODO_01<tab>Speak with the grizzled hunter again.
TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_TODO_02<tab>Speak with the grizzled hunter once more.

TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_000<tab>Why, if it isn't <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! The forest blesses me, for I need a mighty warrior to help keep my recruits sharp─and who better to do that than one of the Third Promise's retinue?

TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_002<tab>Their trainin' is due to start in Xmun Hojaw, to the south. If you're ready and willin' to show off your skills to a few eager hunters, we'll be awaitin' you there.

TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_010<tab>Welcome, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! It's good you came─I was beginnin' to worry my vawtsaral br'aax would become bored, and bored prey makes for boring sport.
TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_011<tab>Is that surprise I sense? What else did you expect? Some in the Brethren of Br'aax train the beasts of our namesake to fight alongside them─me, for one.
TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_012<tab>Now go on, show these kittens what a real fighter is made of! I don't expect any quarter from you!

TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_020<tab>Well, they lasted longer than I expected, at least. Nothin's a better teacher than bitter defeat, eh? I'll mend their hurts later─don't worry, the only lastin' wounds'll be to their ego.

TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_022<tab>Now, you probably have better things to do than humor an old man and his pets. Let's get back to Iq Br'aax and we'll see about gettin' you paid for your efforts.
TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_030<tab>There you are, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Thank you for givin' me a bit of your time today.

TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_031<tab>The techniques we use to tame the forest's beasts have been passed down through generations among the Xbr'aal. You can imagine they were of great use to us durin' our war with the Mamool Ja.

TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_032<tab>Even during these peaceful times, having a few animals at our beck and call makes our daily huntin' all the easier. Of course, we don't need as many as before, so many of our companions were released back into the wilds.
TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_033<tab>Even so, I can't let the knowledge of my forebears die with me. In quiet times as well, I must sharpen their fangs.

TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_034<tab>That being said, my br'aax seem less and less keen to face intelligent foes, but I'm content to just have them hunt by my side. I may have tamed them, but that doesn't change their nature.
TEXT_KINGZD006_05095_ELDERLY05095_000_035<tab>Still, I reckon we all learned somethin' from you today─even me. You deserve this reward for helpin' me keep my own fangs keen!
